metadata.name: Potentially Suspicious Call To Win32_NTEventlogFile Class
metadata.comment: Detects usage of the WMI class "Win32_NTEventlogFile" in a potentially suspicious way (delete, backup, change permissions, etc.) from a PowerShell script

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('win32_nteventlogfile')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.backupeventlog(')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.changesecuritypermissions(')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.changesecuritypermissionsex(')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.cleareventlog(')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.delete(')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.deleteex(')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.rename(')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.takeownership(')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('.takeownershipex('))))

output.summary: Detects usage of the WMI class "Win32_NTEventlogFile" in a potentially suspicious way (delete, backup, change permissions, etc.) from a PowerShell script
